description:
Data Analyst - Junior - TGBC

Be the Difference

Astrion offers comprehensive services that boost preparedness, optimize performance, and ensure success across various domains, from Cyber to Digital, Mission and Systems, servicing our nation's Civilian, Defense and Space communities. We support customers with Centers of Excellence in Washington DC, Huntsville, AL and Burlington, MA with an additional 36 locations across the U.S.

Astrion has an exciting opportunity for an SE-2 Data Analyst for the TMAS 2 96 CTG Task Order, supporting the 46 TS / TGBC.

The data link test flight is searching for Data Analyst with data collection, reduction, and analysis knowledge and some work experience who is interested in designing, constructing, and supporting test and evaluation data analysis systems. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and being on the cutting edge of innovative digital communications technology, this is the place for you. We provide several opportunities to learn and grow, ranging from on-the-job training with other team members to formal courses for unique technology areas.

We realize that no one will possess all the qualifications listed below. We are looking for people that have a strong technical education, some experience and have the drive and motivation to learn other required areas. Position responsibilities can span from assisting a team lead as a team member to leading a project team.

This position provides support to the 46 Test Squadron/TGBC at Eglin AFB as a Data Analyst. This is NOT a telework position; however, limited telework opportunities may be authorized as mission requirements allow.

JOB DETAILS

LOCATION: Eglin AFB

JOB STATUS: FT

TRAVEL: 25%

Required Qualifications / Skills

  • Bachelor of Science in related technical field (i.e., EE, ME, AE, CS, etc.). This position is considered an entry level engineering slot; relevant engineering experience limited to internships or co-ops positions will be considered useful.
  • Ability to acquire SECRET clearance within six months, Interim clearance required to start
  • Must be capable of traveling to contractors' facilities, test sites, and other locations, both CONUS and OCONUS. Travel time could be up to 25%.
  • Proficiency in the use and integration of MS Office applications.
  • Familiarity with IP based networking concepts and protocols.
  • Knowledge of data analysis methods and tools.
  • Effective oral and written communications skills.
  • Comfortable working in a team environment.

Desired Qualifications / Skills

  • Experience with formatted message data streams over IP, RF, or serial connections
  • Understanding of digital data protocol based data exchange.
  • Experience with data analysis tools such as MatLab, PowerBI, SiSense.
  • Experience with Python scripting tool with analytical application.
  • Possess a current and active Top Secret security clearance.

Responsibilities

  • Perform as a member of the Tactical Data Link Gateways test and evaluation team.
  • Provide technical support, conduct data analysis, and apply knowledge of analytical methods to evaluate measures of system performance.
  • Develop in conjunction with the test team and/or work independently in planning, developing, executing, and reporting on data management and analysis plans (DMAP).
  • Develop and review data collection architectures for lab and systems under test.
  • Directly support test engineers and other project members when interacting with System Program Offices, other services, Joint Battle Labs, as well as development contractors.
  • Coordinate test assets, support assets, and data collection device availability to ensure sufficient data is collected to evaluate measures of performance.
  • Support data analysis working groups to measure system performance and conduct root cause analysis.
  • Conduct technical research, development, test and evaluation, and reporting of emerging analysis systems affecting the data analysis efficiency and effectiveness supporting test and evaluation.
  • Assist test teams with real-time data analysis and data collection.
  • Lead post-test analysis and reporting teams.
  • Identify areas for improvement and recommend technical solutions.
  • Attend meetings as necessary to provide briefings, information, recommendations.
  • Review technical plans and reports for technical accuracy.
  • Travel to contractors' facilities, test sites, and other locations.
  • Perform or conduct test procedures, data management, data reduction, data analysis, configuration management, hardware setup, and hardware troubleshooting and documentation.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salaries
  • Continuing education assistance
  • Professional development allotment
  • Multiple healthcare benefits packages
  • 401K with employer matching
  • Paid time off (PTO) along with a federally recognized holiday schedule

Who We Are

At Astrion, we innovate, elevate, and shape the world of tomorrow. At our core is our purpose to “Be the Difference”. This means we encourage our employees to take action and be the driving force for positive change. We foster an environment where innovative solutions flourish and our company continuously evolves.

We have a culture of care, empathy, and making a tangible difference within our organization and communities. We embrace continuous learning, growth, and innovation, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. We promote collaboration and empowering our teams is at the core of our success.

Join Astrion and Be the Difference in your career and the world!

Astrion is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

“Air Force Cyber Division”

#CJ

#DICE
